title: Kindergarten
subject: Extended Content Standards For English Language Arts (2017-)

document.title: North Carolina EXTENDED CONTENT STANDARDS English Language Arts K-12

C35555955152413BA5144DA299DFFD96.description: With guidance and support, use words acquired through conversations, being read to, and during shared reading activities.

73BC391AFD004EFF915B8126F64FF36F.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.6 – Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for
reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in developing vocabulary
knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

81DC5E2EE57C413CA3C39312BFA4A00B.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring opposites.

076B3EE194CD46DAAF3B0D9B47E846DB.description: Sort common objects into familiar categories.

80FDC809DFC7472F8138F6C5C4536280.description: With guidance and support, demonstrate emerging understanding of word relationships.

188C8927D7D84E619810D854CFD1BD61.description: CCR Anchor Standard L.5 – Demonstrate understanding of figurative language and nuances in word meanings.

4214BEF657A048B08A57C5BAB9CFF196.description: With guidance and support demonstrate knowledge of word meanings used in every day routines.

9C4E86E6AFE24699B10FACADFF1AC63C.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.4 – Determine and clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context
clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

FB49715BE4C6408982D9B3CE8089C81F.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.3 – Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective
choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully reading or listening.

0B18BAF8F03F4C2A9746D842E57429AC.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.2 – Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when
writing; demonstrate proficiency within the appropriate grade band conventions continuum.

B32C171AA73A4F62938D792764AADBC7.description: Demonstrate emerging understanding of letter and word use within the K-1 grammar continuum when writing or communicating.

947D6DC510E54E74AF11706BFBC0ADDE.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.1 – Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking;
demonstrate proficiency within the appropriate grade band grammar continuum.

F5C6DD4F690B4F32890FB7D310EF1C9F.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.6 – Determine whether information presented in diverse media (book, newspaper, video, television, internet) is
credible and identify discrepancies.

CCADC97DCF274B29A497A080E53682D5.description:
With guidance and support add or select drawings or other visual or tactual displays to communicate about familiar people, places, things, and
events.

70272D5C59204729BFC93969DF7D8DCD.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.5 – Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance
understanding of presentations.

511B90F5F768485FA060A07E489D8F3E.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.4 – Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning
and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

A55A886E7BD344D499B9A5BFB88B0BCA.description: With guidance and support ask for help when needed.

91908297B779426FB79D942BE51ADE06.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.3 – Determine whether information presented in diverse media (book, newspaper, video, television, internet) is
credible and identify discrepancies.

12829BB2676847EA8DFF7F277ACA5F1E.description:
Demonstrate an emerging understanding of a familiar text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by identifying
objects, images, or other representations of the text.

801A56A906B5468B9143ED9D163B6DAB.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.2 – Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively,
and orally.

AB000624A74E431197B15D5A1D3FBF4B.description: Participate in multiple-turn communication exchanges with support from adults.

50396EBC5D4F4B55988D918DC7571D00.description: Communicate directly with supportive adults or peers.

9E0771E6238B4D8993E01B5A72218C7D.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.1 – Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners,
building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

423F3D8CA9F34381BAB47DC488BA6CD3.description: With guidance and support from adults, identify information, objects, or events that relate to personal experiences.

012CCA67F2354C24962E0A3E2A135D7B.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.6 (from Proposed Standards – was W.8 in 2010 Standards) – Gather relevant information from multiple print and
digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

3494AF46BADB4A0496A20C5DED947E76.description: With guidance and support, participate in shared research and writing projects.

43914ED225B24FF1901A5221E7BD6BCE.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.5 (from Proposed Standards – was W.7 in 2010 Standards) – Conduct short as well as more sustained research
projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

F959681D265D4DEC94EC8E5779FDBF1A.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce group writing.

16144F416F6A46E3B986C36893B4F002.description: CR Anchor Standard W.4: Use digital tools and resources to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

16BC7A272E614A1CBDEBCD1C7A46FA63.description: With guidance and support, select a familiar event and use drawing, dictating, or writing to share information about it.

95554BDEC9BE43868383480C72597B8E.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.3 – Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen
details, and well-structured event sequences.

05C8393698D94B64827CC0A22979D112.description: With guidance and support, select a familiar topic and use drawing, dictating, or writing to share information about it.

EB88F1ADCD40462FAAD373DEE5EFC8D4.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.2 – Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and
accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

E904D5155694486C830AD78066DC500F.description: With guidance and support, select a familiar book and use drawing, dictating, or writing to state an opinion about it.

E05EEEF079B148BA9989E00A34508941.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.1 – Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and
relevant and sufficient evidence.

3D1515D5C34E499DA4E56629F613662C.description: Engage in purposeful shared reading of familiar text.

CF5D93CE4F7B45F3B6D0DD479F358370.description: With guidance and support, recognize environmental print.

47D9DEC5B5D049F4B42A3FB38979EC20.description: With guidance and support, recognize first letter of own name in print.

9D731006D26C454A8D43DAEEB89A515A.description: With guidance and support, identify single-syllable, familiar, spoken words with the same onset (beginning sound).

E84B4467C4264842B788FE2DA09914F8.description: With guidance and support, recognize the number of words in a spoken message.

305F2AAF5A7E488D96BC3F6963354FB4.description: With guidance and support, recognize rhyming words.

4CDEC273552C4EABB746F84BEDED343A.description: Demonstrate emerging understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

6D207591CD6E4820B26EBC34E18D8E17.description: With guidance and support, selects or produces letters when asked to write

97C1C89DB0054DB981593AE0BCE36854.description:
With guidance and support during shared reading, demonstrate understanding of the one-to-one correspondence between written and spoken
words.

BC472B4530BA43389FFFBE18EEE90057.description: With guidance and support during shared reading, demonstrate understanding of the orientation of books and other forms of print.

198FB2BCF29B4D13996765B75F2AC8BC.description: With guidance and support during shared reading, demonstrate understanding that print is read left-to-right and top-to-bottom.

5B736216C20F4D4484316ABCEA4CD024.description: Demonstrate emerging understanding of the organization of print.

1399AA9E4DFA497A836111EC62147A5D.description: Actively engage in group reading of informational text.

9F92C9F25EDF4FA19F21A91D2023590B.description:
CR Anchor Standard RI.10: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently, connecting prior
knowledge and experiences to text.

99C82E96054A4FCDA78B33D419758439.description: With guidance and support, identify something that is the same about two familiar texts on the same topic."

91A4721999E3426CBBAD78143D6C798B.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.9 – Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare
the approaches the authors take.

EDD45ADB05384055A3CD6695A4386649.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.8 – Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as
well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

88D5DC83550B40A7BC0CFCDA3267E5C7.description: With guidance and support, identify illustrations or objects/tactual information that go with a familiar text.

C1B63AE15A6C41159B878306F8A75479.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.7 – Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively,
as well as in words.

51F5623AB8D04D93809A7B95338F9DE1.description: With guidance and support, distinguish between words and illustrations in a familiar informational text.

D9C9379D644D4011A4C59EF160BDE939.description: CCR Anchor Standard RI.6: Assess how point of view, perspective, or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

005E2F14B8284F48A362E64ACA2FA57C.description: With guidance and support, identify the front cover of the book."

8D184D993A924EB3BFB874F0CF8A985E.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.5 – Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text
(e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

3A08F4F6C1D042089806F8B3366EC0B2.description: With guidance and support, answer what questions about words in a familiar text.

D87E2B285BE94879A9A3A7C0114FAF80.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.4: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning
or tone.

EE84F67D6BB543CE846C9CA97262A14A.description: With guidance and support, identify individuals, events, or ideas in a familiar informational text.

A731FB22F31847D7AC4ED44B5BA92405.description: CCR Anchor Standard RI.3 – Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

5D7DBF07608E41EC8FFFD0D468603507.description: With guidance and support, identify the main topic of a familiar text.

A274689F454F4ABCAE570CAD7EB549A5.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.2 – Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting
details and ideas.

604F8C0E339D4FB1901BAACFBCD4D727.description: With guidance and support, identify a detail in a familiar text.

E40F7CE93C6F4F2E901994647601ADAB.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.1 – Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific
textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

205361C29BA04639AC707891636DA539.description: Actively engage in group reading activities.

1E86BF134AA94516B70A8B5FC9E30225.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.10: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently, connecting
prior knowledge and experiences to text.

5C24B842BE3F46AD91E6C22EEA9E3463.description: With guidance and support, identify the experiences of a character in a familiar story.

6332357256BD4E76B6A429C6281CED1E.description:
CCRAnchorStandardRL.9 – Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the
approaches the authors take.

04F6EF7CBD4840B2A402645134B2E328.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.8 – Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as
well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

F287A2B52A4547BFB268DA0FC1DD2BCC.description: With guidance and support, identify illustrations or objects/tactual information that go with a familiar story.

DD70A76520C04BE995672182F6C6E026.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.7 – Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively,
as well as in words.

BC61BF7E5E42408FBE592A240176E078.description: With guidance and support, distinguish between words and illustrations in a story.

F4EEED99D8A9447987429FA5FCC11A7C.description: CCR Anchor Standard RL.6 Assess how point of view, perspective, or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

8A2F1D96F486432687A91090E91E415A.description: With guidance and support, recognize familiar texts.

55D399197DAC4BAE9FA40DA610C5877D.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.5 – Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text
(e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

49F0E5454D3749CF9EFD4784492F8110.description: With guidance and support, identify feeling words within a familiar story.

A2AE456872524EF18955704A76B11D2F.description: RL.4: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

929EEC6FBF434F0F8643C0B23DB6D5AC.description: With guidance and support, identify characters and settings in a familiar story.

FCF295DB304D4F62B407DEC4BE1BF159.description: CCR Anchor Standard RL.3 –Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

5498119D0D6E4DB8B4CAB474D8A41284.description: With guidance and support, identify key details in familiar stories.

521AB763217D4E3A8D6F50B4A55F0435.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.2 –Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting
details and ideas.

3F567621C8684502B2AD8105D929B000.description: With guidance and support, identify details in familiar stories.

F92FED83ACCA4E86BC0A0A457EFAC6F8.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.1 – Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific
textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
